asap.realizer

Interface Engine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEngine

    public interface Engine
    Interface for the combined functionality of a Player, PlanManager and Planner
    Author:
    welberge

      • updateTiming

        void updateTiming(java.lang.String bmlId)
        Updates the timing for all behaviors in bml block bmlId to reflect the current execution context (e.g. position of limbs).

      • createOffsetPeg

        OffsetPeg createOffsetPeg(java.lang.String bmlId,
                          java.lang.String behId,
                          java.lang.String syncId)
                   throws BehaviorNotFoundException,
                          SyncPointNotFoundException,
                          TimePegAlreadySetException
        Creates an offsetpeg for bmlId:behId:syncId, this peg is linked to the TimePeg in this behaviour
        Throws:
        BehaviorNotFoundException - bmlId:behId does not exist
        SyncPointNotFoundException - syncId is not valid
        TimePegAlreadySetException - bmlId:behId:syncId is already linked to a TimePeg

      • addBehaviour

        java.util.List<SyncAndTimePeg> addBehaviour(BMLBlockPeg bbPeg,
                                            saiba.bml.core.Behaviour b,
                                            java.util.List<TimePegAndConstraint> sac,
                                            TimedPlanUnit planElement)
                                     throws BehaviourPlanningException
        Adds a behavior to the plan. All timepegs in sac must be resolved.
        Parameters:
        planElement - planElement obtained from resolveSynchs, null to create a new planElement
        Returns:
        a list of all syncs of the behavior and their linked TimePegs
        Throws:
        BehaviourPlanningException - if no behavior satisfying sac can be constructed

      • resolveSynchs

        TimedPlanUnit resolveSynchs(BMLBlockPeg bbPeg,
                            saiba.bml.core.Behaviour b,
                            java.util.List<TimePegAndConstraint> sac)
                     throws BehaviourPlanningException
        Resolves TimePegs for behavior b, given some known time pegs and constraints
        Parameters:
        b - the behavior
        sac - the provided time pegs and constraints, missing constraints are filled out by this method
        Returns:
        the object to be placed in the plan (a TimedMotionUnit, SpeechUnit, ...)
        Throws:
        BehaviourPlanningException - if no behavior satisfying sac can be constructed

      • getSupportedBehaviours

        java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends saiba.bml.core.Behaviour>> getSupportedBehaviours()

      • getSupportedDescriptionExtensions

        java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends saiba.bml.core.Behaviour>> getSupportedDescriptionExtensions()

      • reset

        void reset(double time)
        Reset the engine, that is: stops all behaviors, then removes them from the plan and restores the startup state (default pose etc).

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Clean up resources constructed with the planner (e.g. for native stuff, spawned threads, ...). A planner should not be (re)used after shutting it down.

      • setBMLBlockState

        void setBMLBlockState(java.lang.String bmlId,
                      TimedPlanUnitState state)
        Set the state of all behaviors with bmlId bmlId in the plan to state

      • play

        void play(double time)

      • getRigidity

        double getRigidity(saiba.bml.core.Behaviour beh)
        Returns:
        : 0 behavior should adjust completely to the timing of other behaviors, 1:completely inflexible

      • setId

        void setId(java.lang.String newId)

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
